alert.note: Alert for Chuska Mountains; Tusas Mountains Including Chama (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued March 01 at 10:42PM MST until March 02 at 5:00PM MST by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 5 PM MST THURSDAY... * WHAT...Heavy snow. Total snow accumulations between 6 and 12 inches possible with higher amounts up to 18 inches above 9000 feet in the Tusas Mountains. Winds could gust as high as 45 mph producing blowing snow and low visibility. * WHERE...Tusas Mountains Including Chama and Chuska Mountains. * WHEN...Until 5 PM MST Thursday. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult. Tire chains may be necessary if traveling through mountain passes.
info.instruction: If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency. For the latest road conditions, dial 511 or 1.800.432.4269, or visit http://nmroads.com.

area.areaDesc: Chuska Mountains; Tusas Mountains Including Chama
